== Downloading Lubuntu 15.04 ==
For our LTS version, 14.04, head over <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Lubuntu/GetLubuntu/14.04.01 | here]]</nowiki>

=== Checklist ===
1. Do read the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/VividVervet/ReleaseNotes/Lubuntu | Release Notes]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/VividVervet/ReleaseNotes | Known Issues]]</nowiki>. This will inform you of changes and known issues.
2. The default "Desktop" installer requires 384-800 MB of RAM (depending on  your selected options.)  If you have any problems, or if  you're comfortable using a keyboard interface, try the <nowiki>[[Lubuntu-Alternate_ISO | alternate installer]]</nowiki> to install on computers with less RAM or a hard disk smaller than 4.3 GB.
3. Check <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToMD5SUM | MD5SUM]]</nowiki> for the downloaded ISO - You will need to compare your MD5SUM with <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuHashes | Ubuntu Hashes]]</nowiki>.
4. <nowiki>[[BurningIsoHowto | Burn]]</nowiki> the CD OR create a bootable USB flash drive - using <nowiki>[[http://unetbootin.sourceforge.net/ | UNetbootin]]</nowiki> is highly recommended
5. Check USB or CD Disc for Errors.  When you boot the default installer, you will see the option to "Check Disc For Errors", otherwise, check for errors <nowiki>[[Lubuntu-Documentation-CheckISO_CD | manually]]</nowiki>. 

=== Torrent ===

Please use the <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BitTorrent | torrent link]]</nowiki> to download, it will be a faster download and will save on costs for bandwidth for the Canonical servers... which means more money in the budget for all of the Ubuntu flavours.

=== Alternative Install ===

Alternate ISOs are for low-RAM PCs. Computers with less than 400 MB of RAM are considered low-RAM computers. You can find more information  about Alternative Install <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Lubuntu/Alternate_ISO|here]]</nowiki>.
